DOC.brief_title: An Evidence Based Smoking Cessation Program Persons Living With HIV/AIDS ( Project Legacy )
DOC.detailed_description: If participant agrees take part study , follow do first visit ( call Baseline Visit ) : - The study staff give participant advice quit smoking . Participant set quit date , plan smoke anymore . - Participant receive 10-week supply nicotine patch instruction use . - Participant complete questionnaire laptop computer smoking habit , much tobacco use , many time tried quit , ready quit , dependent nicotine . The questionnaire take 30 minute complete . Participant assign 1 2 study group . Participant 1 5 ( 20 % ) chance assign Group 1 , 4 5 ( 80 % ) chance assign Group 2 . If participant Group 1 : - Participant receive telephone number hotline use call talk someone quitting . Participant call hotline anytime need support effort quit smoking . - Participant also receive 11 phone call study staff 6-month period . During call , participant give support help quit . Each call last 15 minute . If participant Group 2 : - Participant receive text message support quit smoking . In first week , participant get 20 text message . Each week , participant receive few text message , get 1 message per week week 4 . Participant get 1 message week month 6 . - Participant also receive another text message 1 time week study staff ask smoke within past 24 hour . Participant ask respond text message either send text back study staff call study staff . If study staff receive participant 's response may receive phone call staff ask smoking status past 24 hour . Follow-Up Visits ( Both Groups ) : Three ( 3 ) 6 month Baseline Visit , complete questionnaire laptop computer participant ask information smoking status . At visit , participant also ask blow cardboard tube check byproducts smoke . These visit last 20 minute . Length Study : Participant study 6 month . This investigational study . Up 1000 patient take part study . All enrol Legacy Community Health Services Clinic .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Receiving care HIV/AIDS Legacy Community Health Services Clinic 2 . 18 year age old 3 . Selfreported current smoker ( smoke least 100 cigarette lifetime smoke every day day ) 4 . Able provide write informed consent participate 5 . English Spanish speaking 1 . Positive history medical condition precludes use nicotine patch 2 . Current use nicotine replacement therapy ( NRT ) 3 . Current use smoking cessation medication ( e.g. , Chantix Zyban ) 4 . Pregnant nursing 5 . Enrolled another smoking cessation study 6 . Unwilling set target quit date
